'Cyclic guanosine monophosphate' ('cGMP') is a cyclic nucleotide derived from
guanosine triphosphate (GTP). cGMP acts as a second messenger much like cyclic
AMP. Its most likely mechanism of action is activation of intracellular protein
kinases in response to the binding of membrane-impermeable peptide hormones to
the external cell surface.
